paragraphs.text: Logic ALWAYS follows intuition. Not the other way around. To repeat, logic always follows intuition. Hence, Albert Einstein has said, “I use my intuition, not logic, to help make these important decisions.”
Every beautiful thing you will ever create must come truly from you. And the only way for you to do that work, and to make those connections, is for you to STOP WORRYING ABOUT YOURSELF.
DON’T BE AFRAID.
paragraphs.name: b86b

paragraphs.text: When you’re trying to do something that has never been done before, you can’t be afraid of what people will think. Of course small-minded people will flinch and scoff. Every breakthrough was always considered a crazy idea before it worked.
paragraphs.name: fff2

paragraphs.text: Logic ALWAYS follows intuition. Not the other way around. To repeat, logic always follows intuition. Hence, Albert Einstein has said, “I use my intuition, not logic, to help make these important decisions.”

Logic ALWAYS follows intuition. Not the other way around. To repeat, logic always follows intuition. Hence, Albert Einstein has said, “I use my intuition, not logic, to help make these important decisions.”

paragraphs.name: 8e29
paragraphs.text: Connect powerfully.

paragraphs.name: e264
paragraphs.text: Of course, there are rules you can follow. But at the end of the day, you have to follow your gut. You have to create and live in the way that makes most sense to you. It will only truly work if it’s authentic. If people can feel it.

paragraphs.name: 2bc2
paragraphs.text: “Being afraid will limit you,” George told Filoni. “And most importantly, it will limit your creativity. If you become afraid of what you are trying to do.”

paragraphs.name: 2bc2
paragraphs.text: “Being afraid will limit you,” George told Filoni. “And most importantly, it will limit your creativity. If you become afraid of what you are trying to do.”
It was a common experience for people to tell George Lucas, “That cannot be done.” Those words were the very ammunition he needed. To quote Darren Hardy, “Let the haters be your motivators.”
Courage is the baseline to everything positive. It’s the ground. It’s the starting point.
Courage is the baseline to everything positive. It’s the ground. It’s the starting point.

paragraphs.name: d302
paragraphs.text: Hence, Warren Buffett has said, “It’s better to live your life by an inner scorecard than an outer scoreboard.”
If the feeling is not there, then the creator wasn’t feeling it either. They were forcing it. They were afraid.
paragraphs.name: 5c5e
4c7a
paragraphs.text: “If as a creative person, you have decided that the artiber of whether it was good or not, or whether your time was well-spent or not, is how it is received by other people, you have now taken your sense of self worth and you have deferred it out. You have placed it in other people’s control. And they are going to let you down from time-to-time. They are not going to appreciate what you did. They’re going to judge it. They’re going to be afraid of it.”

paragraphs.name: cdd0
paragraphs.text: ah yes, in the words of Peter Diamandis — “the day before something is truly a breakthrough, it’s a crazy idea. If it wasn’t a crazy idea, it’s not a breakthrough; it’s an incremental improvement”

64bcb9895ab3.title: No. The lesson then should not be to NOT be afraid.

paragraphs.name: 4db0
paragraphs.text: No. The lesson then should not be to NOT be afraid. It’s inhuman to NOT be afraid. Fear is an emotion and it’s a part of life. It’s a barometer that keeps us in check as we walk the line of life and tells us of impending danger as we walk the line of life. I think the true lesson should be then that we need to learn to push through the fear. Because on the other side of that fear is where the victory is found.
